metadata.title: CVE-2016-3191 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The compile_branch function in pcre_compile.c in PCRE 8.x before 8.39 andpcre2_compile.c in PCRE2 before 10.22 mishandles patterns containing an(*ACCEPT) substring in conjunction with nested parentheses, which allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service(stack-based buffer overflow) via a crafted regular expression, asdemonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror, akaZDI-CAN-3542.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre3 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
libpcrecpp0 - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
pcregrep - 1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:8.31-2ubuntu2.2').
